note.p: Death: His residence, 77 Inverness Terrace, London (01 April 1900)
Education: PhD (1876, received from the Pope); MD (1884, University of Louvain)

Career: Lecturer, later Professor, of Comparative Anatomy, St Mary's Hospital Medical School, London (1862-1884); President, Biological Section of the British Academy (1879); member of the governing council of the Catholic Union (early 1880s); Professor of the Philosophy of Natural History, University of Louvain (1890-1893); excommunicated for beliefs expressed in magazine articles
Memberships: MRI (1849); FZS (1858); FLS (1862); Metaphysical Society (1874)
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1905 vol 75 pp 95-100 signed by G B H
